name: id
comment: Unique identified for the record

name: forward_pearson_correlation_coefficient
comment: Forward Pearson Correlation Coefficient. Pearson correlation coefficient between cause and effect measurements. Ex: 0.0333 (type: number)

name: onset_delay
comment: Onset Delay. User estimated or default time after cause measurement before a perceivable effect is observed. The amount of time in seconds that elapses after the predictor/stimulus event before the outcome as perceived by a self-tracker is known as the onset delay. For example, the onset delay between the time a person takes an aspirin (predictor/stimulus event) and the time a person perceives a change in their headache severity (outcome) is approximately 30 minutes. (type: string)

name: duration_of_action
comment: Duration of Action. Time over which the cause is expected to produce a perceivable effect following the onset delay. The amount of time over which a predictor/stimulus event can exert an observable influence on an outcome variable value. For instance, aspirin (stimulus/predictor) typically decreases headache severity for approximately four hours (duration of action) following the onset delay. Unit: Seconds (type: string)

name: number_of_pairs
comment: Number of Pairs. Number of points that went into the correlation calculation. Ex: 298 (type: integer)

name: value_predicting_high_outcome
comment: Value Predicting High Outcome. cause value that predicts an above average effect value (in default unit for cause variable). Ex: 4.14 (type: number)

name: value_predicting_low_outcome
comment: Value Predicting Low Outcome. cause value that predicts a below average effect value (in default unit for cause variable). Ex: 3.03 (type: number)

name: optimal_pearson_product
comment: Optimal Pearson Product. Ex: 0.68582816186982 (type: number)

name: average_vote
comment: Average Vote. Vote. Average of all user votes with 1 representing an up-vote and 0 representing a down-vote. Ex: 0.9855 (type: number)

name: number_of_users
comment: Number of Users. Number of Users by which correlation is aggregated. Ex: 1 (type: number)

name: number_of_correlations
comment: Number of Correlations. Number of Correlations by which correlation is aggregated. Number of correlations for this variable (type: integer)

name: statistical_significance
comment: Statistical Significance. A function of the effect size and sample size. Ex: 0.9813 (type: number)

name: cause_unit_id
comment: Cause Unit ID. Unit ID of Cause.

name: cause_changes
comment: Cause changes. Ex: 164 (type: integer)

name: effect_changes
comment: Effect changes. Ex: 193 (type: integer)

name: aggregate_qm_score
comment: Aggregate QuantiModoScore. Aggregated QuantiModo Score.

name: created_at
comment: Time at which the Aggregate Correlation was Created At. When the record was first created. Use UTC ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss datetime format. Time zone should be UTC and not local. (type: string)  in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS in the UTC timezone.

name: updated_at
comment: Time at which the Aggregate Correlation was Updated At. When the record was last updated. Use UTC ISO 8601 YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss datetime format. Time zone should be UTC and not local. (type: string)  in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS in the UTC timezone.

name: status
comment: Status. ex. OK or ERROR (type: string)

name: reverse_pearson_correlation_coefficient
comment: Reverse Pearson Correlation Coefficient. Correlation when cause and effect are reversed. For any causal relationship, the forward correlation should exceed the reverse correlation. Ex: 0.01377184270977 (type: number)

name: predictive_pearson_correlation_coefficient
comment: Predictive Pearson Correlation Coefficient. Ex: 0.538 (type: number)

name: data_source_name
comment: Data Source Name.

name: predicts_high_effect_change
comment: Predicts High Effect Change. The percent change in the outcome typically seen when the predictor value is closer to the predictsHighEffect value. Ex: 17. Unit: User-specified or common. (type: integer)

name: predicts_low_effect_change
comment: Predicts Low Effect Change. The percent change in the outcome from average typically seen when the predictor value is closer to the predictsHighEffect value. Ex: -11. Unit: User-specified or common. (type: integer)

name: p_value
comment: P Value. The measure of statistical significance. A value less than 0.05 means that a correlation is statistically significant or consistent enough that it is unlikely to be a coincidence. Ex: 0.39628900511586 (type: number)

name: t_value
comment: T Value. Function of correlation and number of samples. Ex: 9.6986079652717 (type: number)

name: critical_t_value
comment: Critical T Value. Value of t from lookup table which t must exceed for significance. Calculated Statistic: Ex: 1.646 (type: number)

name: confidence_interval
comment: Confidence Interval. A margin of error around the effect size.  Wider confidence intervals reflect greater uncertainty about the â€œtrueâ€ value of the correlation. Ex: 0.14344467795996 (type: number)

name: deleted_at
comment: Time at which the Aggregate Correlation was Deleted At.  in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS in the UTC timezone.

name: average_effect
comment: Average Effect. Ex: 3.0791054117396 (type: number)

name: average_effect_following_high_cause
comment: Average Effect Following High Cause. Ex: 3.55 (type: number)

name: average_effect_following_low_cause
comment: Average Effect Following Low Cause. Ex: 2.65 (type: number)

name: average_daily_low_cause
comment: Average Daily Low Cause. Ex: 1.97 (type: number)

name: average_daily_high_cause
comment: Average Daily High Cause. Ex: 4.19 (type: number)

name: population_trait_pearson_correlation_coefficient
comment: Population Trait Pearson Correlation Coefficient.

name: grouped_cause_value_closest_to_value_predicting_low_outcome
comment: Grouped Cause Value Closest to Value Predicting Low Outcome.

name: grouped_cause_value_closest_to_value_predicting_high_outcome
comment: Grouped Cause Value Closest to Value Predicting High Outcome.

name: client_id
comment: Client ID. Your QuantiModo client id can be obtained by creating an app at https://builder.quantimo.do (type: string)

name: published_at
comment: Time at which the Aggregate Correlation was Published At.  in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS in the UTC timezone.

name: wp_post_id
comment: Wp Post ID.

name: cause_variable_category_id
comment: Cause Variable Category ID. Ex: 6 (type: integer)

name: effect_variable_category_id
comment: Effect Variable Category ID. Ex: 1 (type: integer)

name: interesting_variable_category_pair
comment: Interesting Variable Category Pair.

name: newest_data_at
comment: Time at which the Aggregate Correlation was Newest Data At.  in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS in the UTC timezone.

name: analysis_requested_at
comment: Time at which the Aggregate Correlation was Analysis Requested At.  in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS in the UTC timezone.

name: reason_for_analysis
comment: Reason for Analysis.

name: analysis_started_at
comment: Time at which the Aggregate Correlation was Analysis Started At.  in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS in the UTC timezone.

name: analysis_ended_at
comment: Time at which the Aggregate Correlation was Analysis Ended At.  in the format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS in the UTC timezone.

name: user_error_message
comment: User Error Message.

name: internal_error_message
comment: Internal Error Message.

name: cause_variable_id
comment: Cause Variable ID. Variable id of the hypothetical predictor variable.  Ex: 1398 (type: integer)

name: effect_variable_id
comment: Effect Variable ID. Variable id of the outcome variable of interest.  Ex: 1398 (type: integer)

name: cause_baseline_average_per_day
comment: Cause Baseline Average Per Day. Predictor Average at Baseline (The average low non-treatment value of the predictor per day).

name: cause_baseline_average_per_duration_of_action
comment: Cause Baseline Average Per Duration of Action. Predictor Average at Baseline (The average low non-treatment value of the predictor per duration of action).

name: cause_treatment_average_per_day
comment: Cause Treatment Average Per Day. Predictor Average During Treatment (The average high value of the predictor per day considered to be the treatment dosage).

name: cause_treatment_average_per_duration_of_action
comment: Cause Treatment Average Per Duration of Action. Predictor Average During Treatment (The average high value of the predictor per duration of action considered to be the treatment dosage).

name: effect_baseline_average
comment: Effect Baseline Average. Outcome Average at Baseline (The normal value for the outcome seen without treatment during the previous duration of action time span).

name: effect_baseline_relative_standard_deviation
comment: Effect Baseline Relative Standard Deviation. Outcome Average at Baseline (The average value seen for the outcome without treatment during the previous duration of action time span).

name: effect_baseline_standard_deviation
comment: Effect Baseline Standard Deviation. Outcome Relative Standard Deviation at Baseline (How much the outcome value normally fluctuates without treatment during the previous duration of action time span).

name: effect_follow_up_average
comment: Effect Follow Up Average. Outcome Average at Follow-Up (The average value seen for the outcome during the duration of action following the onset delay of the treatment).

name: effect_follow_up_percent_change_from_baseline
comment: Effect Follow Up Percent Change From Baseline. Outcome Average at Follow-Up (The average value seen for the outcome during the duration of action following the onset delay of the treatment).

name: z_score
comment: Z Score. The absolute value of the change over duration of action following the onset delay of treatment divided by the baseline outcome relative standard deviation. A.K.A The number of standard deviations from the mean. A zScore > 2 means pValue < 0.05 and is typically considered statistically significant.

name: charts
comment: Charts visualizing Aggregate Correlation data.
